definition: everywhere/all over/classifier for actions: one time
to walk (side part of split character)
flat/(coll.) to beat (sb) up/old variant of 匾[bian3]
to cover the whole (area)/to be found throughout
to blossom everywhere/to spring up all over the place/to flourish on a large scale
to go everywhere/to scour (the whole town)
covered all over with cuts and bruises/beaten black and blue/be a mass of bruises
lit. covering the mountains and the plains (idiom)/fig. as far as the eye can see/covering everything/omnipresent
covering the whole land/over hills and dales
lit. plaintive whine of geese (idiom); fig. land swarming with disaster victims/starving people fill the land

sentences.english: I made/had him copy the lesson 20 times.
sentences.chinese: 我叫他把这篇课文抄写20遍。

sentences.english: Just as if some one was kissing the window all over outside.
sentences.chinese: 就好像有人从外面把窗子吻了个遍。

sentences.english: We heard fireworks crack all over the village.
sentences.chinese: 我们听到烟火的劈劈啪啪声响遍了整个村庄。

sentences.english: I never tire of listening to this serenade.
sentences.chinese: 这支小夜曲我听多少遍也不觉得厌烦。

sentences.english: A stronger oath yet is the one that is repeated 50times.
sentences.chinese: 不过，另一种还要庄重的誓言就是重复50遍。

sentences.english: How many times do I have to spell it out?
sentences.chinese: 我要仔仔细细讲多少遍？

sentences.english: Park trees planted flowers, potted and decorative during which a large number.
sentences.chinese: 园内遍植树木花卉，并以大量盆花点缀其间。

sentences.english: The northland corpse heap, such as , the dust spreads Sui Tang in a twinkling, the empire firework time world.
sentences.chinese: 北国尸体堆如麻，尘土瞬间洒隋唐，帝国烟火遍天下。

sentences.english: The speech had already been redrafted 22 times.
sentences.chinese: 演讲稿已经改写过22遍了。

sentences.english: Who will gazed on my picture till eyes turned sored?
sentences.chinese: 如果我消失了，谁会捧着我的相片一遍遍的凝视？

sentences.english: The history teacher was furious and gave me 100 lines.
sentences.chinese: 历史老师很生气，罚我抄书100遍。

sentences.english: The locals know the city far better than the foreigners.
sentences.chinese: 当地人对这个城市的了解遍礅地人要多的多。

sentences.english: If you do something over and over again, you develop a habit.
sentences.chinese: 当你一遍遍做某件事的时候，你会培养一种习惯。

sentences.english: We've heard over and over again that success happens when preparation meets opportunity.
sentences.chinese: 我们曾一遍又遍听过，成功发生于准备遇上机会之时。

sentences.english: Gardener, lofty title, I wish you students everywhere, Springfield over the Quartet.
sentences.chinese: 园丁，崇高的称号，祝您桃李满天下，春晖遍四方。

sentences.english: I can call spirits from the vasty deep, " he said again."
sentences.chinese: “我可以召唤我内心最深处的东西，”他又重复了遍。

definition: one time (all the way through)/once through
to know by heart (so well that you can recite it backwards)
variant of 重複|重复[chong2 fu4]
sentence/clause/phrase/classifier for phrases or lines of verse
from start to finish/from head to tail/the whole (thing)
to brush/to paint/to daub/to paste up/to skip class (of students)/to fire from a job
to turn over/to flip over/to overturn/to rummage through/to translate/to decode/to double/to climb over or into/to cross
to make a round trip/return journey/back and forth/to and fro/repeatedly
to toss and turn (sleeplessly)/again and again
to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)
